FuncDef:
The dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable command enables a DHCP relay agent to insert the Option 82 Subscriber-ID into DHCP request packets on a specified interface.
The undo dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable command disables the function.
By default, a DHCP relay agent is disabled from inserting the Option 82 Subscriber-ID into DHCP request packets on a specified interface.
CLIs: dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable self-define <self-define-value>
undo dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable [ self-define <self-define-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a user-defined character string of Option 82 suboption6 (Subscriber-ID) to be inserted into DHCP request packets.
The value is a string of 1 to 251 case-sensitive characters. Letters, digits, and special characters are supported.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-Eth-Trunk1] dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable self-define hwformat
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable a DHCP relay agent to insert the Option 82 Subscriber-ID into DHCP request packets on a specified interface, run the dhcp option82 subscriber-id insert enable command. The Option 82 Subscriber-ID carries Internet service provider (ISP) information, allowing the DHCP server to assign addresses and other parameters based on the ISP information if the server supports the Subscriber-ID sub-option.
